item.description:
This is one of the most interesting times of year to visit Beaver Brook Association Nature Center in Hollis because it is the weekend of their Annual Fall Festival and Art&Photography show.  We will take a hike first from 2-3 or so to Spatterdock Pond and along Beaver Brook Trail.  Hopefully there will be some fall colors showing along the wetlands.  Before or after this hike (at 1 pm and 3 pm) there is a free presentation "Live Birds of Prey" by Wingmasters.  There is homemade food, live music and a nature art exhibit by over 70 regional artists in the historic Maple Hill Barn. So there is plenty to do and see if you come for a hike this day!

Rain or Shine!  Parking is across the street from Maple Hill Barn.  Volunteers will point you to parking and the Yurt.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at the Yurt at Beaver Brook Association 117 Ridge Road Hollis NH
item.name: A Hike, Live Owls & Nature Art & Photography Show
